text: Kitty was there every day, as much of an institution as any politician. But even after seeing her almost daily for 10 years while I covered the Nebraska Legislature, I learned little about her personal life. She was private, professional and a damn fine person. Farewell, Kitty.
author: sbauerAP

text:
In Nebraska, the pages are college students. Kitty showed them the ropes, who to avoid and who to embrace, all while they got a firsthand look at the lawmaking process.

She was funny, nobody’s fool and a damned hard worker, more than could be said of many senators.
author: sbauerAP

text: Most state Capitols have people like Kitty who work for years behind the scenes, know everything and everybody, but are rarely (never) recognized or appreciated for their integral roles in the process. Lawmakers come and go, but it’s the people like Kitty who make the place run
author: sbauerAP

text: Kitty Kearns was a beloved, integral part of the Nebraska Legislature. As unique as that state’s unicameral structure, Kitty presided over the page program with love, dedication and a healthy dose of cynicism. She devoted her life to that place.
author: sbauerAP

text: Congrats to @news3jessica !!

text:

No word yet on whether he will do that, or abide by the lame-duck law that forbid replacing @ScottWalker appointee Mark Hogan until September

text:
Waiting for Kaul to respond

Republicans are going to appeal the judge's ruling, but since he didn't issue a stay, Evers is free to invoke all the powers he had taken away by lame-duck laws while they are temporarily blocked from being enforced

text: Full story on Laurie "Bambie" Bembenek pardon request:
author: sbauerAP

text:
She was released on parole in 1992 after her original conviction was set aside and she agreed to plead no contest to second-degree murder.
Bembenek had a pardon request pending with then-Gov. Jim Doyle in 2010 when she died at age 52 in Oregon of liver failure.
author: sbauerAP

text: Bembenek's case riveted Wisconsin and the nation. She was a Milwaukee police officer and a former Playboy club hostess who escaped from a Wisconsin prison in 1990, inspiring the phrase "Run Bambi Run."
author: sbauerAP

text:
Breaking on @AP 

The attorney for Wisconsin's famous runaway convict and convicted murderer Laurie "Bambi" Bembenek is asking @GovEvers for a pardon

Bembenek insisted up until her death in 2010 that she did not kill the ex-wife of her husband in 1982.
author: sbauerAP

text: _ Both candidates weren't shy about taking swings at the other. Hagedorn accused Neubauer of "shameful" attacks and not being honest with voters about her judicial philosophy. Neubauer repeatedly hit Hagedorn for being @ScottWalker personal attorney for 5 years
author: sbauerAP

text:
Takeaways from first of two Wisconsin Supreme Court debates:

_ @JudgeNeubauer stuck to talking points, emphasizing 98% of judges endorsing back her, saying she will be fair, impartial & independent

_ @judgehagedorn had a more natural delivery, vigorously defended his past work
author: sbauerAP

text:
.@JudgeNeubauer, in a dig at @judgehagedorn who said some judges are supporting him but he's not putting it on his website, says of the 345-plus judges backing her:

"They are willing to support me publicly, I have put them on my website."
author: sbauerAP

text:
.@judgehagedorn says he has plenty of judges supporting him and "just because they're not there on my website" doesn't mean they don't back him

@JudgeNeubauer has emphasized, and repeated, that she has more than 340 judicial endorsements
author: sbauerAP

text:
@JudgeNeubauer is staying on message by repeating often that she has more than 340 judicial endorsements and her go-to line about being fair, impartial and independent

@judgehagedorn accuses her of having "empty catchphrases"
author: sbauerAP

text:
.@JudgeNeubauer says she is not "out there signaling to people as my opponent is every single day in the campaign as to how he's going to (rule)"

The question was about whether she's coordinating with outside groups spending money on her behalf, which she didn't answer
author: sbauerAP

text:
.@judgehagedorn when asked if he's coordinating with outside groups spending money on his behalf, which state law now permits:

"No, we are not doing any coordination with outside groups at all."
author: sbauerAP

text:
.@judgehagedorn refuses to commit to opening Supreme Court administrative hearings, says he will look at it

Neubauer wants to re-open the meetings, which had been public under former Chief Justice Shirley Abrahamson

The race is to replace Abrahamson, who is retiring
author: sbauerAP

text:
.@JudgeNeubauer continues to hammer @judgehagedorn on his past work for former @ScottWalker 

Hagedorn says Neubauer is carrying water for liberal special interests
author: sbauerAP

text:
.@JudgeNeubauer says she supports opening rule-making conferences at the Wisconsin Supreme Court that have been closed after being open for years

"We need to have those conferences be open" for public to see how decisions about administrative procedure are made
author: sbauerAP

text:
.@JudgeNeubauer when asked about judicial recusal rule:

"We have to know that our people know our courts are there for them."
author: sbauerAP

text: .@judgehagedorn says he would recuse himself from cases involving parties that have made a "substantial donation" to his campaign
author: sbauerAP

text: .@judgehagedorn says he made no decisions while @ScottWalker attorney for more than five years
author: sbauerAP

text:
.@JudgeNeubauer says Roe v Wade is settled law: "It is te law of the land."

@judgehagedorn:  says Roe v Wade and other cases like it "are binding precedent and it's my obligation to follow them."
author: sbauerAP

text:
.@judgehagedorn to @JudgeNeubauer 

"The attacks you are making are shameful. ... You're spreading the talking points from the very special interest groups that you once called toxic."
author: sbauerAP

text: .@JudgeNeubauer raises blog posts @judgehagedorn wrote while in law school on "key constitutional issues"
author: sbauerAP

text: .@JudgeNeubauer drops a reference to Phil Donahue, w TV personality that I doubt anyone under age 40 will know
author: sbauerAP

text: .@judgehagedorn says in his opening he first got interest in being a judge when he served as a law clerk for former Wisconsin Supreme Court Justice Michael Gableman: "I've been there."
author: sbauerAP

text: .@JudgeNeubauer in opening statement: "My record shows that I am tough but fair. My records shows that I am impartial, fair and independent as a judge and that is what this race is all about."
author: sbauerAP

text: The Wisconsin Supreme Court is airing live on http://channel3000.com  and will be broadcast on WISC in Madison on Sunday at 10:30 p.m.
author: sbauerAP

text: The Wisconsin Supreme Court candidates took their podiums without a handshake, but it’s possible they did it backstage or earlier during sound check
